greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = the smallest prime divisor of A173426(n) = concatenation of (1, 2, 3,..., n, n-1, ..., 1) for n > 1; a(1) = 1.
example: A173426(37) = 39907897297 * P58 * P59, where Pxx are primes with xx digits, therefore a(37) = 39907897297.
program: (PARI) A075023(n)=A020639(A173426(n)) \\ Efficient code for computing the least prime factor should be developed in A020639. For n = 37, use \g3 (debugging level 3) to see the lpf within milliseconds, while factorization would take hours. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 29 2015
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Sep 01 2002
ext: Terms beyond a(24) from _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 29 2015
